questions.question_text: Where are the timeframe conditions for sending an SLA breach warning notification defined?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
eBook

Selected Answer: B
This one is tricky, but it states, "timeframe conditions for sending an SLA BREACH WARNING notification".

A SLA Definition is used to define SLAs at the REQ, RITM, and SC Task level.

But the Default SLA Flow use percentages to "Time Breach Warning" and "Breach Notice" emails rather than actual time.

Answer is B
B is correct, Tokyo book, p. 292

Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is A. The flow fires the notification but where you define SLA is what determines when those notifications will fire.

Selected Answer: B
B correct

Selected Answer: B
b is ok
I believe this is B, that's the name of the SLA flow inside flow designer.

Selected Answer: B
textbook P292
Default SLA flow Action wait until 50, 75, 100%

Selected Answer: B
B and D gets added, but to read, it only needs the read one ;)

Selected Answer: D
Answer is D. The customer is granting access to "VIEW" records (sn_problem_read). The additional role should be the access to write (sn_problem_write)

B or D are correct according to 
https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/utah-it-service-management/page/product/incident-management/task/req-itsm-roles-inci-mgmt.html

Selected Answer: B
B is required sn_problem_read

Selected Answer: B
https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/utah-it-service-management/page/product/problem-management/reference/prob-roles-instld-itsm-roles.html
B, sn_problem_read
E is incorrect it's B and D.
Correct answer should be B

Selected Answer: B
sn_problem_read
only for read problem record.

questions.question_text: Your customer wants to give secure access to business users to view problem records and reports for the products they support. When you install the ITSM roles plugin, what additional problem role is installed to support this requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
IT Service Management (ITSM) Implementation - Vancouver / page 321

D. problem_admin
Ebook link - https://evantage.gilmoreglobal.com/reader/books/SN-ITSMI-V010-PG-E/pageid/320

Selected Answer: D
d is ok

Selected Answer: D
p337
D. problem_admin

Selected Answer: D
Correct
Problem_admin, itil_admin + itil, admin can delete problem record.

questions.question_text:
A new Problem Coordinator accidentally created several problem investigations that need to be deleted.

What role is required to delete a problem record?

choices.C: Tester is not impersonating Problem Coordinator
choices.A: The Problem Management Best Practice - Madrid - Knowledge Integration plugin has not been activated
choices.B: The customer did not pay the bill for Knowledge management
choices.D: The sn_known_error_write role is required to see the Create Known Error article link
choices.E: The requirement was not in the stories

discussion.content: Page 343 of Vancouver

Selected Answer: A
From the book:
With the Problem Management Best Practice - Madrid and Problem Management Practice - Madrid - Knowledge Integration plugins, users can create a knowledge article using the Known Error template by clicking the Create Known Error article from the Related Links section of the problem record.

Selected Answer: A
a is ok

Selected Answer: A
ITSM Implementation Tokyo eBook pg357

comments.content: Can you send the link of the book that you are referring?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
p357
plugin missing

Selected Answer: A
A is definitely correct, Tested in the instance, the app is not installed default.

Selected Answer: A
Key: Known Error knowledge base in the instance is missing
plugin not insatlled
Answer is A

Selected Answer: C
Tester is not impersonating Problem Coordinator .
problem_coordinator is allowed to create Knowledge error article

Selected Answer: A
Correct is A
Role with: admin, problem_admin, problem_coordinator, or problem_manager, can create Known Error article.
https://docs.servicenow.com/ja-JP/bundle/utah-servicenow-platform/page/product/knowledge-management/concept/knowledge-article-templates.html
